title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 August 2014 - XWiki
content:

09:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:17 <vmassol> good morning everyone. Reminder: today is BFD  
09:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
09:31 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, there was a change in job api in 6.1  
09:35 <DarkKnightCZ> huh? what is the correct way of starting job in 6.2 since JobManager is deprecated? getting instance from componentManager and executing with ExecutorService throws NPE in AbstractJob.jobStarting(line 233)  
09:37 <DarkKnightCZ> injecting JobExecutor and starting it with execute method? (i guess it's asynchronous)  
09:40 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:41 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: in JobManager javadoc you have "@deprecated since 6.1M2, use {@link JobExecutor} instead"  
09:46 <tmortagne> it's pretty much the same API but JobExecutor is always asyncronous  
09:47 <tmortagne> you can then call Job#join() if you want to wait  
09:47 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yup, i have tried that now, and see it's not related to this api change... for unknown reason, job fails with NPE (AbstractJob throws NPE on line 233, so i guess it cannot obtain Request object)  
09:48 <tmortagne> you get NPE when you call join() ?  
09:48 <DarkKnightCZ> all i do to request is setId and setRemote, my job extends AbstractJob<DefaultRequest, DefaultJobStatus<DefaultRequest>> and has per\_lookup instantiation strategy  
09:48 <DarkKnightCZ> nope, when executing job  
09:48 <tmortagne> the issue is probably more in the job itself than the way you call it  
09:49 <DarkKnightCZ> http://pastebin.com/Zq6EmziV -> this is the stacktrace  
09:49 <tmortagne> what version of XWiki is that ? looks like I don't have the same line 233 than you  
09:50 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <tmortagne> a 233 sorry  
09:50 <DarkKnightCZ> it's 6.2 just before M2 release (three days ago)  
09:50 <tmortagne> are you just to give a Request object to execute ?  
09:51 <tmortagne> this NPE seems to mean that the request object is null  
09:51 <DarkKnightCZ> http://pastebin.com/Hut7jzdL  
09:52 <DarkKnightCZ> this is how i execute that job (and with previous api on 5.x it worked without problems)  
09:52 <tmortagne> do you overwite initialize() in your job ?  
09:52 <tmortagne> I mean initialize(Request request)  
09:53 <DarkKnightCZ> nope  
09:53 <tmortagne> that's what set the request field in AbstractJob  
09:53 <tmortagne> or maybe castRequest then  
09:53 <tmortagne> otherwise I really don't see how this field can end up null  
09:54 <DarkKnightCZ> well, my job only overrides getType and runInternal  
09:54 <tmortagne> I guess the best here if you can is to debug and put a breakpoint in AbstractJob#initialize(Request request)  
10:00 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ok, i will try that  
10:12 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
10:15 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: how can i debug that with eclipse? I've connected to remote xwiki instance, i can see the thread, but if i suspend it, it's always at Waiting for DefaultVelocityManager (i start the job with script service)  
10:38 <tmortagne> don't suspend the thread, put a breakpoint in AbstractJob#initialize(Request request)  
10:39 <tmortagne> go the the method in Eclipse and toggle a breakpoint  
10:39 <tmortagne> Eclipse will warn you when it reach that point  
10:39 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so it will take a lot of time?  
10:40 <DarkKnightCZ> ha, finally  
10:41 <DarkKnightCZ> request is set (XWikiInitializerRequest)  
10:42 <DarkKnightCZ> but request id is xwiki  
10:43 <tmortagne> I think you can put a breakpoint on  
10:43 <tmortagne> protected R request;  
10:43 <tmortagne> to check when it's modified  
10:43 <tmortagne> maybe something is setting it to null after for some reason  
10:44 <DarkKnightCZ> i set it after the line that sets request, it was correct... if i put breakpoint on line 233, request is set too  
10:45 <DarkKnightCZ> any ideas, what could be wrong then?  
10:46 <DarkKnightCZ> (properties entrySet and keySet is null)  
10:48 <tmortagne> when stopped on line 233, what Eclipse gives you for getRequest() ?  
10:50 <tmortagne> that's the only thing that can be null on that line so I don't understand how else you would get a nullpointer  
10:50 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, that was different job  
10:50 <tmortagne> ok  
10:54 <Denis> has quit  
10:55 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <vmassol> has quit  
10:59 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <NuxRo> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <NuxRo> Hi guys, I've got an xwiki instance that I did all sorts of tests on, I'd like to use it in production now, but I'd like to empty the DB somehow, to get rid of all those random pages I created  
11:05 <NuxRo> what would be the best way to do this?  
11:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
11:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: what does metadataresolver do? It appears i'm stuck in an infinite loop (it literally takes forever to load webpage when debugging)  
11:12 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: no idea what metadataresolver you are talking about exactly ? a Eclipse thing ?  
11:13 <DarkKnightCZ> daemon thread, defaultmetadataresolver, looks like something from aether  
11:13 <tmortagne> ok, sorry no I don't really know what it does exactly  
11:14 <tmortagne> maybe aether use a deamon thread to pile the actual downloads  
11:14 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, ok, i will try to disable most of functionality to debug it  
11:24 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ha, found it, observationManager is null  
11:25 <tmortagne> that does not make any sense  
11:25 <tmortagne> the component would fail to be created  
11:25 <tmortagne> let me check again your code  
11:25 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
11:25 <tmortagne> http://pastebin.com/Hut7jzdL does not exist anymore  
11:26 <tmortagne> you are creating the job object yourself ?  
11:26 <DarkKnightCZ> nope  
11:27 <DarkKnightCZ> http://pastebin.com/XLsmBs3e  
11:27 <DarkKnightCZ> jobExecutor is injected  
11:37 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: could you paste the code of AvatarSyncJob ?  
11:40 <NuxRo> guys, where do I need to download mysql jar and modify the hibernate config file, in root/WEB-INF or xwiki/WEB-INF?  
11:40 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/y1sNJ9N0  
11:41 <DarkKnightCZ> NuxRo: xwiki/WEB-INF/lib -> mysql jar, xwiki/WEB-INF/ -> hibernate config file  
11:42 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: private ObservationManager observationManager;  
11:42 <tmortagne> in http://pastebin.com/y1sNJ9N0  
11:42 <tmortagne> you are overwriting the one in AbstractJob  
11:42 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, i guess i'm overriding it  
11:42 <tmortagne> which makes it hidden  
11:42 <tmortagne> hidden from component manager that is  
11:43 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
11:43 <tmortagne> the one in AbstractJob is protected  
11:43 <tmortagne> you can directly use it  
11:43 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
11:47 <Lyes> has quit  
11:48 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <NuxRo> thanks DarkKnightCZ  
12:00 <NuxRo> I have created a mysql db, modified the hibernate file, have the mysql jar installed and I even see that there are new tables in the DB, but I cannot login with Admin/admin now  
12:01 <NuxRo> any ideas?  
12:02 <DarkKnightCZ> NuxRo: no problem, anything in logs? (and did you modify authclass in xwiki.cfg?)  
12:03 <NuxRo> I haven't modified anything (haven't found any such instructions)  
12:04 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: works like a charm, thanks  
12:05 <DarkKnightCZ> NuxRo: ok, thats good, anything in logs?  
12:06 <NuxRo> just says "invalid credentials" and these 2 lines in the data/logs:  
12:06 <NuxRo> 172.16.5.145 -  -  [28/Aug/2014:10:05:36 +0000] "GET /xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?xredirect=%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fadmin%2FXWiki HTTP/1.1" 401 8481  
12:06 <NuxRo> 172.16.5.145 -  -  [28/Aug/2014:10:05:41 +0000] "POST /xwiki/bin/loginsubmit/XWiki/XWikiLogin HTTP/1.1" 403 8620  
12:12 <NuxRo> I started the wiki with the debug.sh startup script, but not much more info  
12:12 <NuxRo> 014-08-28 11:09:08,238 [XWiki initialization] INFO  .HibernateDataMigrationManager - Storage schema updates and data migrations are enabled  
12:12 <NuxRo> 2014-08-28 11:09:08,238 [XWiki initialization] INFO  .HibernateDataMigrationManager - No data migration to apply for wiki [xwiki] currently in version [54300]  
12:12 <NuxRo> 2014-08-28 11:09:08,238 [XWiki initialization] INFO  .HibernateDataMigrationManager - Checking Hibernate mapping and updating schema if needed for wiki [xwiki]  
12:12 <NuxRo> whatever that means, still can't login with Admin user  
12:22 <NuxRo> so.. any easy way to switch from hsqldb to mysql?  
12:22 <NuxRo> i dont care about the content  
12:27 <tmortagne> vmassol1: any idea if the default document syntax changed recently ?  
12:28 <vmassol1> tmortagne: you mean in XWikiDocument.getDefaultDocumentSyntax()?  
12:28 <vmassol1> "XWIKI-7352: Make XWiki Syntax 2.1 the default syntax"  
12:28 <vmassol1> that's old now  
12:29 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
12:30 <tmortagne> anyway debuging http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10818, pretty sure the issue is about importing a document that does not have any syntax in the XML  
12:30 <vmassol> ok  
12:41 <NuxRo> has left #xwiki  
12:41 <lucaa> has quit  
13:08 <vmassol> wow haven't started XE for a long time  
13:09 <vmassol> just doing so and it take so long now  
13:09 <vmassol> (with flamingo)  
13:09 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: btw I really find the login screen ugly  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: this one? http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28342/after.png  
13:13 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: yes but this screenshot is ok, the problem are the footer and geader  
13:13 <vmassol> \*header  
13:14 <vmassol> this is what I get: https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/bb052470-b094-4beb-834d-b23abf3dc58f/3106ac46ac4393b98cee2ff61151a371  
13:15 <vmassol> (notice the very visible footer exactly in the middle of the screen)  
13:17 <gdelhumeau> the proposal is acually http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28185/loginInitialProposal.png  
13:18 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: yes it's much better except for the background  
13:18 <vmassol> (packed with features, etc)  
13:21 <vmassol> grrr lots and lots of job faiing on ci  
13:21 <vmassol> I wonder how we're going to know if we break aytnhing with our new commits of today  
13:21 <vmassol> even platform is not building  
13:48 <DarkKnightCZ> by the way, i've got issues with localization in 6.2, http://pastebin.com/iash3uwR , which looks like an issue either with obtaining proper xcontext or obtaining wiki from him (some strings, mostly in admin section, are then not translated), is this known issue?  
13:48 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10777  
13:48 <vmassol> apparently lots of people are getting it  
13:48 <vmassol> we need to fix it ASAP  
13:49 <vmassol> ah fixed by tmortagne  
13:49 <DarkKnightCZ> great  
13:49 <vmassol> err no  
13:50 <vmassol> still open but he marked it as bfd  
13:50 <vmassol> strange  
13:50 <DarkKnightCZ> maybe he is planning to do it today  
13:50 <vmassol> so I guess he plans to work on it today  
13:50 <vmassol> yeah  
13:50 <vmassol> usually we mark afterwards  
13:50 <vmassol> beause we never know if we're going ot be able to finish it or not during the day  
13:51 <DarkKnightCZ> yup  
14:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: "beause we never know if we're going ot be able to finish it or not during the day" I know what is the issue, just need to go out of Skype...  
14:20 <vmassol> ok  
14:20 <vmassol> just building platform  
14:21 <vmassol> and getting failure for solr  
14:21 <vmassol> solr-query  
14:21 <vmassol> Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentManager] hint = [context]]  
14:21 <vmassol> analyzing  
14:22 <vmassol> in org.xwiki.query.solr.SolrQueryExecutorTest  
14:24 <vmassol> does it work for yu? can you build solr-query?  
14:25 <vmassol> seems the dep is missing  
14:25 <vmassol> (xwiki-platform-component-multi  
14:26 <vmassol> hmm no  
14:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: you caused it :)  
14:29 <vmassol> XWIKI-10855: Impossible to use a QueryExecutor installed as extension  
14:29 <vmassol> so you broke the platform build!  
14:30 <vmassol> fyi the problem surfaces in SolrQueryExecutorTest which now requires a mock for Context CM (or the real instance)  
14:30 <vmassol> I'll let you fix it  
14:40 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you should compare the startup speed of XE before flamingo and with flamingo IMO. I have the feeling there's several seconds of difference mabye caused by the LESS compilation  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> Sure it is  
14:40 <vmassol> it doesn't look good  
14:41 <vmassol> maybe some pre-compiled CSS files  
14:41 <vmassol> I mean precompiled LESS files into CSS f  
14:41 <vmassol> s/f/  
14:41 <vmassol> in any casei t's not ok IMO to slow the startup by several seconds  
14:42 <vmassol> hmm export is taking forever too  
14:43 <vmassol> PDF export that is  
14:43 <vmassol> let me time try it with colibri too  
14:43 <gdelhumeau> I have published that: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LESS+Module#HCacheStrategy  
14:44 <gdelhumeau> but it does not fix the pb for the very first time  
14:52 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I've created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10879  
14:53 <Denis> has quit  
14:55 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: commented  
15:02 <msmeria> has quit  
15:03 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:26 <gdelhumeau> 8 blockers for the release  
15:28 <vmassol> for the release of Monday.....  
15:28 <vmassol> and the build is broken in lots of places....  
15:28 <vmassol> we're in bad shape  
15:37 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I hope you verified there's no side effects by your change of order :)  
15:37 <vmassol> also  
15:37 <vmassol> you didn't put any comment  
15:37 <vmassol> explaining the order  
15:38 <vmassol> iin the vm file  
15:38 <vmassol> you really should  
15:38 <vmassol> so that we remember it
